I've read the last 4-5 pages and I've not found anyone with the same problem.

I've installed this mod back in the 1.1 along Kerbal Konstruct and it did not work. When steam updated to 1.1.1 and RSS was not working I actually had the option to choose the launch pads (In the tracking station) way north to the Kerbal Space Center and Kerbal Kontruct was working in the VAB I could select every launchpad, now that I got back the RSS/RO Pack in 1.1.2 I've downloaded this mod again and I still have the same issue. When I'm in the VAB and I over the "KK" logo of the mod it just says with a green text "Selected launchsite is Launch Pad" and I cannot see the various launchpads on the tracking station.

I'll provide images/logs if needed.

From what I understand, Kerbal Konstructs (required for this mod) and Real Solar System don't work with each other right now. It was discussed very briefly in the Kerbal Konstructs thread with nothing coming from it other than the author mentioning he'd look into it eventually. Pretty much a waiting game. That being said, I haven't tested the most recent version of KK but there is no mention of it being fixed.

Version 0.1.0 for Kerbal Space Program 1.1 is the oldest download in SpaceDock. I tried it and no parts show up. Too bad

I think this mod is a little behind on updates. Every update we should have 1 to 2 new pads. When this mod started it said "this WILL be updated regularly." If this was for 1.0.4 and KerbalStuff didn't shut down I think Bob Fitch did a good job on getting it complete. Basically the new images we get are only teasers for something coming out in a month or so. I was waiting very long just for this mod to update. I'm not saying you need to put EVERYTHING at once. But please try to add a few every once in a while.![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Your problem is probably the default KK configuration files list Kerbin as the celestial body, this makes the KK screens not appear, best way is to either modify all the configs in KK to say Earth, or just delete the \*.cfg from the folder statics in the KK directory, they are not necessary. This mod requires you to also rename the celestial body to Earth in the configs for it to appear in RSS.

> 9 minutes ago, Adam Kerman said:
> 
> 
> I got a bug with this mod= the launch pads are below ground and my rockets are put above ground above the launch pads
> 

All you need to do is to press CTRL and K  and it will show a Kerbal Konstructs statics editor. go to all the Atlas 1,2 things and press snap to terrain. do the same to all of the GenericMissileRow pads.![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")
